# Data

## Description
The dataset originates from the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System (YRBSS),
conducted by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The data is 
in CSV format and contains health-related variables such as physical activity, 
sleep hours, and screen time. The dataset has approximately 13,500 rows and 
multiple variables (age, grade, gender, etc.). It was imported into R using 
the read.csv() function. Some columns contain missing values, which will require
cleaning or imputation. The dataset is publicly available on the CDC's website 
at YRBSS Data.

## Missing value analysis
```{r}
library(tidyverse)  
library(naniar)   

data <- read.csv("yrbss.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

missing_values <- colSums(is.na(data))
print("Missing Values Per Column:")
print(missing_values)

gg_miss_var(data) + 
  labs(title = "Missing Values Per Column", x = "Variables", y = "Number of Missing Values")

gg_miss_upset(data)

missing_df <- as.data.frame(missing_values[missing_values > 0], stringsAsFactors = FALSE) %>%
  rownames_to_column(var = "Variable") %>%
  rename(MissingCount = `missing_values[missing_values > 0]`)

ggplot(missing_df, aes(x = reorder(Variable, -MissingCount), y = MissingCount)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Number of Missing Values Per Column", x = "Variable", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal() +
  coord_flip()
```
